sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"著名的，知名的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: famous, noted, prominent, outstanding, notorious, eminent, notable
means: famous ： 是普通用词，指传播很广，引起人们注意的人或事物。
noted ： 多指因成绩卓著而备受注意的专家或权威及其著作，有时含贬义。
prominent ： 指出人头地，为公众所熟悉，至少在地方上闻名。
outstanding ： 侧重指因素质优良，功绩卓著而超过同类的人或物，强调"突出"。
notorious ： 指因劣迹而臭名昭著，含强烈贬义；但有时也作"众所周知的"解。
eminent ： 指在某方面杰出卓越或突出的人或物。
notable ： 用于指事件时，侧重其重要、值得注意；用于指人时，与famous同义，但语气较弱。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"显著的，引人注意的"之意。
means: outstanding ： 通常指与同行或同类的人相比显得优秀或杰出，或具有他人或别的事物所没有的特征。
noticeable ： 指所描绘的事物引人注意。
remarkable ： 通常指因有与众不同的特点或优越性而引起人们注意或称道。
conspicuous ： 通常指因成绩卓著，而引人注意，或指因外观奇特、花哨或言行举止不合常规而令人注意。
striking ： 侧重能给观察者产生强烈而深刻印象。

sentence.Network_en: You have to pay your outstanding bill before joining the scheme.
sentence.Network_cn: 在参加该项目之前必须结清余账。

sentence.Network_en: His citation says he showed outstanding and exemplary courage.
sentence.Network_cn: 颁给他的嘉奖令称他表现出非凡的勇气，堪为表率。

sentence.Network_en: Patrick Devlin was an outstanding judge and brilliant jurist.
sentence.Network_cn: 帕特里克·德夫林是一位杰出的法官和出色的法律专家。

encyclopedia.content: outstanding a. 杰出的， 突出的， 未偿付的， 未决定的 【经】 未解决的， 未偿付 例句 balances outstanding with branches 联行汇差 funds outstanding for settlement 结算中占用资金 Outstanding debts; a long outstanding problem. 有待偿还的债务；长期悬而未决的问题 in an outstanding manner or to an outstanding degree. 以突出的方式或者到了突出的地步。 An outstanding keyboard technique. 杰出的键盘技巧

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as outstanding, you think that they are very remarkable and impressive.

example.ex: Derartu is an outstanding athlete and deserved to win.
example.tran: 德拉尔图是位优秀的运动员，赢得比赛也是理所当然。
自然景色美不胜收的地方

entry.def: Money that is outstanding has not yet been paid and is still owed to someone.

example.ex: The total debt outstanding is $70 billion...
example.tran: 未偿债务总额达700亿美元。

example.ex: You have to pay your outstanding bill before joining the scheme.
example.tran: 在参加该项目之前必须结清余账。

entry.def: Outstanding issues or problems have not yet been resolved.

example.ex: We still have some outstanding issues to resolve before we'll have a treaty that is ready to sign.
example.tran: 我们签协议之前还有一些未尽事宜待解决。

entry.def: Outstanding means very important or obvious.

example.ex: The company is an outstanding example of a small business that grew into a big one...
example.tran: 该公司是小企业成长为大企业的突出例子。

example.ex: His mother, whose influence on his development was outstanding, came of a distinguished American family.
example.tran: 对他的成长影响深远的母亲出身于一个地位显赫的美国家庭。

means.word_mean: 2. having a quality that thrusts itself into attention;

sentences.sentence: "an outstanding fact of our time is that nations poisoned by anti semitism proved less fortunate in regard to their own freedom"
"a new theory is the most prominent feature of the book"
"a striking thing about Picadilly Circus is the statue of Eros in the center"
"a striking resemblance between parent and child"
"Einstein was one of the outstanding figures of the 20th century"

auth_sentence.content: Negotiations on all outstanding issues cannot be avoided.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Negotiations on all outstanding issues cannot be avoided.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"出去.过时,外面"; 2. 表示"超过.过度"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 室外的, 户外的, 野外的
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+door门→adj.室外的, 户外的, 野外的
out出去.过时,外面+er→adj.外部的,外面的,外层的
out出去.过时,外面+going走→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
out出去.过时,外面+land地+ish……的→外地来的→奇异的
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out超过.过度+size范围→范围超出
out超过.过度+standing标准的→adj.突出的, 显著的
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+side旁边→在外边
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out出去.过时,外面+break中断→事情断裂→爆发
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 外出, 旅行, 散步
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+ing状态→n.外出, 旅行, 散步
out出去.过时,外面+let表名词→n.出口, 出路
out出去.过时,外面+line线条→划出线条→大纲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 景色, 风光, 观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+look看→n.景色, 风光, 观点

stems_affixes.value_cn: 产量, 输出, 输出量
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+put放,摆→放出,输出→产量
out出去.过时,外面+rage怒气→怒气外露→粗暴
out出去.过时,外面+set安置好→在外面放置好→开端
out出去.过时,外面+skirt裙子;引申为城市周边+s→郊区
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+law法律→超越法律之人
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+bid出价→出价超出
out超过.过度+do做→做得超出别人
out超过.过度+live活→超过别人活着
out超过.过度+number数量→v.在数量上超过
out超过.过度+wear穿→穿出了[洞]
out超过.过度+wit智慧→机智超出别人

Sentence.sentence: If supervisors do not acknowledge such outstanding performance, employees may either lose their enthusiasm and reduce their effort or search for a new job at a firm that will reward them for high performance.

In contrast to each of these ideas, Covey advocates that leaders need to understand universal principles of effectiveness, and he highlights how vital it is for leaders to first personally manage themselves if they are to enjoy any hope of outstanding success in their work environments.
According to Stephen Covey, leaders who hope to achieve outstanding success need first of all to manage themselves

means.word_mean: 突出的; 杰出的; 优秀的, 出色的

sentences.en: Her late husband was an outstanding scientist.
sentences.cn: 她已故的丈夫是位杰出的科学家。

sentences.en: The girl who won the scholarship was quite outstanding.
sentences.cn: 得奖学金的女孩是相当杰出的。

means.word_mean: 款项、工作、困难等未偿付的, 未解决的, 未完成的

sentences.en: The outstanding bill must be paid next week.
sentences.cn: 这笔未偿还的账下周必须还清。

sentences.en: A good lot of work is still outstanding.

means.word_mean: 地位显著的; 为人瞩目的; 突出的, 明显的, 重要的

sentences.en: She is a painter outstanding for her landscapes.
sentences.cn: 她是一位以风景画而出名的画家。

jushi.english: He is an outstanding figure in politics.
jushi.chinese: 他是政界中的一位杰出人物。

jushi.english: The outstanding bill must be paid next week.
jushi.chinese: 这笔未偿还的账下周必须还清。

jushi.english: Her late husband was an outstanding scientist.
jushi.chinese: 她已故的丈夫是位杰出的科学家。
